result.title: Ranking Contests
result.content:
By the beginning of the next month, we will start the ranking contests. These are individual contests to test everyone's individual performance and help you pick your teammates. Note that your participation is not obligatory but highly recommended. You participation is important for me and other community coaches. Even if you are not confident you can perform well, your participation may make us discover your potentials and help you with your practice. Also, it will help you in team formation.

Timings

Contest Timing Allowed Participation Days
Ranking Contest #1 Sat. 1 July — 11:00 am 1 — 3 July
Ranking Contest #2 Tue. 4 July — 11:00 am 4 — 6 July
Ranking Contest #3 Fri. 7 July — 03:00 pm 7 — 9 July
Ranking Contest #4 Mon. 10 July — 03:00 pm 10 — 12 July
Ranking Contest #5 (Div-B) Fri. 14 July — 05:00 pm 14 — 16 July
Ranking Contest #5 (Div-A) Sun. 16 July — 05:00 pm 16 — 17 July

You can make virtual participation in the allowed participation days if the selected timings do not fit your schedule. However, it's recommended if possible to take part in the selected timings for fairness with the standings.

Rules

Here we set some important rules for fairness and to get you used to real contest environment. We don't want to bother you and overwhelm you with irrational and unnecessary restrictions. On the other hand, if you are new to the community, then you should know that your honesty comes before anything else.

You Can You Can't
Use the basic PC calculator. If you need complex computations, write code for it Use regular calculators
look at your code library for algorithms and data structures you have already implemented look at old submissions for problems you have already solved
Start the contest with an empty project/package with no class created Copy and paste any line of code out of your project/package
look at any tutorial you already know in a book or online google for problems you don't know
discuss problems during the allowed days of the contests
